Submodules¶

autocoop.exploit_generator module¶

class autocoop.exploit_generator.Config(executable, base_mod, base_buf, max_payload_size, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Holds configuration for ExploitGenerator objects.

Parameters:
  • executable (str) – the executable the payload should be generate for
  • base_mod (int) – address the executable will be loaded at
  • base_buf (int) – address the payload will be loaded at
  • max_payload_size (int) – maximum size of the generated payload
  • kwargs – other arguments to be used by the gadget builders
class autocoop.exploit_generator.ExploitGenerator(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Generates the payload.

Parameters:config (Config) – the configuration of the exploit generator
apply_calltarget_list(candidates, list)[source]¶

Finds and returns all gadgets that are both in the candidate and the valid calltarget lists

Parameters:
  • candidates (list) – Candidate gadgets based on semantic filtering
  • list (list) – Candidate gadgets reachable from dispatcher
Returns:

Valid candidates that are also reachable
Return type:

list
generate_candidate_sets(parsed_program)[source]¶

Generates the set of usable gadgets per gadget type

Parameters:parsed_program (Parser) – Parsed program specifying the gadget types to look for
Returns:Dict of gadget ids and calltarget sets
Return type:dict
generate_payload(parsed_program)[source]¶

Generates a payload that executes the provided program.

Parameters:parsed_program (Parser) – Parser that parsed the program to be executed
Returns:the payload as a bytestring
Return type:str
step_through_program(calls, calltarget_list, candidate_list, prev_gadgets)[source]¶

Steps through the program recursively and generates the appropriate objects

Parameters:
  • calls (list) – Parsed program to step through
  • calltarget_list (list) – List of reachable calltargets
  • candidate_list (dict) – List of candidates per gadget type
  • prev_gadgets (list) – Gadgets preceding the current one in gadget chain
Yields:

list of calltargets and their corresponding objects, in order of execution
